id.description:
The html `id` attribute of the popover.
If not provided, we generate a unique id.

This `id` is also used to auto-generate the `aria-labelledby`
and `aria-decribedby` attributes that points to the `PopoverHeader` and `PopoverBody`
id.name: id

isOpen.description: If `true`, the popover will be opened in controlled mode.
isOpen.name: isOpen

defaultIsOpen.description: If `true`, the popover will be initially opened.
defaultIsOpen.name: defaultIsOpen

initialFocusRef.description: The `ref` of the element that should receive focus when the popover opens.
initialFocusRef.name: initialFocusRef

returnFocusOnClose.description:
If `true`, focus will be returned to the element that triggers the popover
when it closes
returnFocusOnClose.name: returnFocusOnClose

autoFocus.description:
If `true`, focus will be transferred to the first interactive element
when the popover opens
autoFocus.name: autoFocus

closeOnBlur.description:
If `true`, the popover will close when you blur out it by
clicking outside or tabbing out
closeOnBlur.name: closeOnBlur

closeOnEsc.description: If `true`, the popover will close when you hit the `Esc` key
closeOnEsc.name: closeOnEsc

onOpen.description: Callback fired when the popover opens
onOpen.name: onOpen

onClose.description: Callback fired when the popover closes
onClose.name: onClose

arrowSize.description: The size of the popover arrow
arrowSize.name: arrowSize

trigger.description:
The interaction that triggers the popover.

`hover` - means the popover will open when you hover with mouse or
focus with keyboard on the popover trigger

`click` - means the popover will open on click or
press `Enter` to `Space` on keyboard
trigger.name: trigger

isLazy.description:
Performance ðŸš€:
If `true`, the PopoverContent rendering will be deferred
until the popover is open.
isLazy.name: isLazy

lazyBehavior.description:
Performance ðŸš€:
The lazy behavior of popover's content when not visible.
Only works when `isLazy={true}`

- "unmount": The popover's content is always unmounted when not open.
- "keepMounted": The popover's content initially unmounted,
but stays mounted when popover is open.
lazyBehavior.name: lazyBehavior

computePositionOnMount.description:
If `true`, the popover will be positioned when it mounts
(even if it's not open)

Note ðŸš¨: We don't recommend using this in a popover/menu intensive UI or page
as it might affect scrolling performance.
computePositionOnMount.name: computePositionOnMount

enabled.description: Whether the popper.js should be enabled
enabled.name: enabled

offset.description:
The main and cross-axis offset to displace popper element
from its reference element.
offset.name: offset

gutter.description:
The distance or margin between the reference and popper.
It is used internally to create an `offset` modifier.

NB: If you define `offset` prop, it'll override the gutter.
gutter.name: gutter

preventOverflow.description:
If `true`, will prevent the popper from being cut off and ensure
it's visible within the boundary area.
preventOverflow.name: preventOverflow

flip.description:
If `true`, the popper will change its placement and flip when it's
about to overflow its boundary area.
flip.name: flip

matchWidth.description:
If `true`, the popper will match the width of the reference at all times.
It's useful for `autocomplete`, `date-picker` and `select` patterns.
matchWidth.name: matchWidth

boundary.description: The boundary area for the popper. Used within the `preventOverflow` modifier
boundary.name: boundary

eventListeners.description:
If provided, determines whether the popper will reposition itself on `scroll`
and `resize` of the window.
eventListeners.name: eventListeners

type.name: boolean | { scroll?: boolean; resize?: boolean | undefined; } | undefined

arrowPadding.description:
The padding required to prevent the arrow from
reaching the very edge of the popper.
arrowPadding.name: arrowPadding

strategy.description: The CSS positioning strategy to use.
strategy.name: strategy

placement.description: The placement of the popper relative to its reference.
placement.name: placement

modifiers.name: modifiers

direction.description:
Theme direction `ltr` or `rtl`. Popper's placement will
be set accordingly
direction.name: direction
